channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024020562
item.description:
Report X-2024020562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKER WAS DISCOVERED BY UNLOADER REPORTED TO SUPERVISOR DILLON ON DOOR 4 RESPONDER NOTIFIED DMP RESPONDED IN FULL PPE AND BROUGHT BACK PACKAGE TO DMP FOR PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2024020474
item.description:
Report X-2024020474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler reported leaking Hazmat package to Manager. Manager secured package in a plastic lined hazmat tote wearing latex gloves and delivered to QA. DescribePack: Loose leaking cap. Contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept the package up right and secured the loose cap. Contained the package in a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020045
item.description:
Report X-2024020045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: RENO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Both shipments were discovered during sort operations. The first pallet (Trk789319646932) has 8 plastic drums that are labeled “shredded lithium cells” and were leaking 30 ml or less from the top/caps. The litmus test indicated 6-7 ph. The second pallet wrapped in black shrink contained 32 boxes of concealed dg (UN 3268) and one empty box. No Release. Trk# 789400462276. Both pallets are being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024020266
item.description:
Report X-2024020266

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler notified manager of leaking hazmat. Manager notified QA. Leaking hazmat was secured in plastic lined tote by QA wearing gloves and a mask. DescribePack: Bottom of plastic bottle cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA removed leaking hazmat from area, secured package in QA Hazmat cage.
